{
  "description": "The grid transformation involves mirroring specific patterns across the horizontal center of the grid and across a vertical axis, the precise axis may depend on the patterns in the original grid.",
  "operations": [
    "Identify patterns consisting of non-zero elements in the input grid.",
    "Mirror these identified patterns across the horizontal center of the grid.",
    "Identify mirrored patterns across the central vertical axis",
    "Handle overlaps of the transformed mirrored patterns."
  ],
  "output_description": "Grid with symmetrical mirroring of patterns both horizontally and vertically."

```json
{
  "description": "The grid transformation mirrors specific patterns across both horizontal and vertical axes, effectively creating four instances of the pattern.",
  "operations": [
    "Identify non-zero elements in the input grid, considering them as part of a pattern.",
    "For each non-zero element at input[r][c], mirror it across the horizontal center: output[height - 1 - r][c] = input[r][c], where height is the number of rows.",
    "For each non-zero element at input[r][c], mirror it across the vertical center: output[r][width - 1 - c] = input[r][c], where width is the number of columns.",
    "For each non-zero element at input[r][c], mirror it across both horizontal and vertical centers: output[height - 1 - r][width - 1 - c] = input[r][c].",
    "If mirrored elements overlap (same position), sum their values; this is not observed in the training examples so overwrite is acceptable"
  ],
  "output_description": "Grid with symmetrical mirroring of patterns both horizontally and vertically."
}
```
